Model

Class Movie

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model.Movie
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Movie
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents a Movie
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Movie(int id, java.lang.String title, MovieType type, java.lang.String synopsis, java.lang.String rating, double duration, java.time.LocalDate movieReleaseDate, java.time.LocalDate movieEndDate, java.lang.String director, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> cast)
      Creates a Movie with the given attribute Default for reviews is empty (no reviews assigned to movie during movie listing)

      MovieStatus getShowStatus()
      Get the screening status of the Movie Screening status derived from finding the difference between the start/end date and today's date If today's date is after the end date of the movie, it will display "END OF SHOWING" Else, if days difference between today and Movie's start date is more than 7, it is "COMING SOON" Else, if days difference between today and Movie's start date is less than 7, it is "PREVIEW" Else, if today is after Movie's start date and before Movie's end date, it is "NOW SHOWING"

    • Constructor Detail

      • Movie

        public Movie(int id,
             java.lang.String title,
             MovieType type,
             java.lang.String synopsis,
             java.lang.String rating,
             double duration,
             java.time.LocalDate movieReleaseDate,
             java.time.LocalDate movieEndDate,
             java.lang.String director,
             java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> cast)
        Creates a Movie with the given attribute Default for reviews is empty (no reviews assigned to movie during movie listing)
        Parameters:
        id - This Movie's unique ID
        title - This Movie's title
        type - This Movie's type
        synopsis - This Movie's synopsis
        rating - This Movie's rating
        duration - This Movie's duration (in hours) e.g. 1.5 == 1hours 30mins
        movieReleaseDate - This Movie's release date
        movieEndDate - This Movie's end date
        director - This Movie's director
        cast - This Movie's list of casts

      • getOverallReviews

        public java.lang.String getOverallReviews()

      • getShowStatus

        public MovieStatus getShowStatus()
        Get the screening status of the Movie Screening status derived from finding the difference between the start/end date and today's date If today's date is after the end date of the movie, it will display "END OF SHOWING" Else, if days difference between today and Movie's start date is more than 7, it is "COMING SOON" Else, if days difference between today and Movie's start date is less than 7, it is "PREVIEW" Else, if today is after Movie's start date and before Movie's end date, it is "NOW SHOWING"
        Returns:
        MovieStatus Screening status of the movie
